definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: Children such as seedlings, must develop properly, can only germinate grow.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿比如幼苗，必须培养得宜，方能发芽滋长。

sentences.english: Luckily, the mummies are well preserved.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，这些木乃伊都保存得宜。

sentences.english: Those who practice sound of nature should be prudent in how to use it properly.
sentences.chinese: 天籁如何运用得宜，是修行人必须谨慎的。

sentences.english: Proper management of records enhances the efficiency of business in government.
sentences.chinese: 档案管理得宜，有助提高政府办事效率。

definition: more than one would wish/somewhat/a bit too (old, contrived, distracting etc)
to be good at using (sth)/to put (sth) to good use
not to be worried about/all taken care of
to be evident at a glance (idiom)
